did.abstract: Reports, orders, correspondence, memoranda, dispatches, financial records, minutes, printed matter, maps, and photographs relating to Russian military operations in France during World War I; White Russian diplomatic activities and military operations, especially in southern Russia, during the Russian Revolution and Civil War, including military purchasing and intelligence operations; administration of territory under White Russian control during the Civil War; the evacuation of White Russian military personnel and civilians from the Crimea in 1920; and the resettlement of Russian refugees in Turkey and various European countries. Includes records of the Russian Expeditionary Corps in France, the Volunteer Army, the Armed Forces of Southern Russia, the Northwestern Army, the Foreign Supply Directorate, military representatives in foreign countries and attached to the Allied Supreme Command, and the Russian Army in exile, and some personal papers of Baron Petr Vrangel', commander-in-chief successively of the Armed Forces of Southern Russia and Russian Army. The majority of the collection is also available on microfilm (220 reels). Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Microfilm use only (except for box 176 and maps and photographs that have not been microfilmed, as noted in container list). Digital copies of select records also available at https://digitalcollections.hoover.org.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Born, Novo-Aleksandrovsk (Zaraisk), Russia into family of Baltic nobility. Spent childhood and youth in Rostov-na-Donu. Received engineering degree from Gornyi Institut Imperatritsy Ekateriny II, St. Petersburg
Completed requirements of Nikolaevskoe Kavaleriiskoe Uchilishche (I-yi razriad)) and Nikolaevskaia Akademiia General'nago SHtaba (I-yi razriad). Commissioned cornet in Gvardeiskaia Kavaleriia
Took part in Russo-Japanese War with 2-oi Argunskii Kazachii Polk and later Otdl'nyi Divizion Razvedchikov. Received decorations and promotion for bravery
Began service in Leib-Gvardii Konnyi Polk
Completed courses of Akademiia General'nago SHtaba
Took part in World War I. Began as Captain of Cavalry, received St. George's Cross for bravery in the field; promoted to rank of colonel
Appointed commander of Nerchinskii Polk, Zabaikal'skoe Kazachee Voisko
Promoted to Maj.-Gen. and given command of Ussuriiskaia Konnaia Diviziia

Joined Volunteer Army in Ekaterinodar. Appointed commander of 1-ia Konnaia Diviziia and promoted to Lieut.-Gen. by Lieut.-Gen. A. Denikin. Later given command of Volunteer Army and Army of the Caucasus
Appointed Commander-in-Chief of Vooruzhennyia Sily IUga Rossii (V.S.IU.R.) and Military Governor of South Russia. Attempted to reorganize army and carry out land and local government reform

After fall of White Movement, organized evacuation of V.S.IU.R. and civilian refugees first to Constantinople and later to Balkans. Established headquarters of Russian army-in-exile in Sremski Karlovci, Yugoslavia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Vrangel' collection is composed of a group of official archives belonging to Russian government agencies and military departments active during World War I, the Russian Civil War, and the first period of Russian emigration. The collection was originally organized by Lieutenant-General N. Golovin in 1927. Each archive within the collection was retained as an independent entity, while at the same time the collection as a whole was divided into 353 files. The present register maintains this arrangement while attempting to greatly expand the description of material found in individual files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Day-orders, official correspondence, and other documentary material related to the Russian Expeditionary Force in France and on the Saloniki Front. Includes correspondence with Allied Command, especially Ministère de la Guerre, France. Also includes archive of Zavedyvaiushchii Voenno-Sudnoi CHast'iu pri Russkikh Voiskakh vo Frantsii and Voennyi Prokuror Russkikh Voisk vo Frantsii. Files 1-5, 223-235, 252-312.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Special intelligence section "Azbuka": reports and miscellaneous material re its internal organization; Diplomaticheskii Otdel Dobrovol'cheskoi Armii: correspondence and reports; Natsional'nyi TSentr: civil administration of territories occupied by White Army including official decrees of Glavnokomanduiushchii V.S.IU.R. and archive of Osoboe Soveshchanie pri Glavnokomanduiushchem; political situation in territories occupied by White Army, including material re political parties; Ukrainian separatism under Skoropadskii, Petliura and the "Greens": reports and correspondence re political and military situation; Crimea, Kuban' and Don: reports and correspondence re political and military situation. Files 129-136.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Day-orders of Lieut.-Gen. A. Denikin and Baron P. Vrangel'; reports and internal files of "Azbuka," Otdel Propagandy pri Glavnokomanduiushchem and Razvedyvatel'noe Otdelenie pri Glavnokomanduiushchem V.S.IU.R.; political and military situation in Rumania and Bessarabia; political and military situation in the Ukraine under Skoropadskii, Petliura, the Germans and the Soviets; peasant revolts and activity of "Greens"; territories in South Russia and Crimea occupied by White Army: relations with Germans and Allies (French and British); military activity of Allies against Soviet forces; political and military situation in the Caucasus, Transcaucasia and the Caspian Sea; Vremennoe Sibirskoe Pravitel'stvo and Vserossiiskoe Vremennoe Pravitel'stvo (Ufa): printed documents, minutes of meetings and reports. Files 137-170, 180-186, 188.

Political situation in Don region: monarchist groups, Ataman Krasnov, influence of Germans and Allies; disposition and strength of Soviet troops, Voronezh front; composition and training of Soviet troops; peasant uprisings against Soviet occupation and relation of various classes of peasants to Soviet power; situation in Taganrog. Typescript,

Intelligence reports, Razvedyvatl'noe Otdelenie SHtaba Glavnokomanduiushchago, Voenno-Agenturnyia Svodki. Includes letters from intelligence agents, eyewitness reports and newspaper clippings re: general situation in Soviet occupied territory, including reports and letters from Moscow; Bolshevik terror, typescript excerpt from Izvestiia, ; Red Army, organization and deployment; Caucasus, including Armenia and Georgia; "Latyshskie bol'sheviki v Rossii"; Ukraine, Natsional'nyi TSentr; German colonists, Volga region; Poland, Latvia and Byelorussia; Jewish role in the Revolution; information received from foreign missions (French and British); transmissions of Soviet radio news; Maritime Provinces and the Far East. Includes reports of foreign missions and eyewitness accounts; composition and disposition of Petliura's army; Polish-Ukrainian negotiations; excerpts from Polish press; internal political situation in Ukraine; Odessa; Kiev; Rumania; Red Army, disposition in south; Galician troops, disposition and activity; miscellaneous Green organizations, typescript and handwritten,

Reports of special intelligence section, "Azbuka" and Razvedyvatel'noe Otdelenie SHtaba Glavnokomanduiushchago. Political and military situation of "Directory"; Makhno; Vinnichenko-Petliura crisis; fall of Getman Skoropadskii, establishment of "Directory"; situation in Odessa; situation in KHar'kov; Vinnichenko-Petliura break, fall of Directory; Kiev under Bolshevik control; KHar'kov, Poltava province and Ekaterinoslav under Bolshevik control; Kiev, right-wing organizations; general political and military situation in the Ukraine, Azov-Dnepr Front. scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, contracts, purchase orders, and financial reports related to the purchase of military and other supplies for anti-Soviet forces in Siberia, North-West and South Russia. Includes correspondence of Lieut.-Gen. E. Hermonius with government agencies and private firms mostly in Great Britain, France and the U.S. Files 6-37, 39-44, 46-51, 60-80.

did.unittitle: Office correspondence of Lieut.-Gen. E. Hermonius and other material related to the administration of his department, typescript and handwritten
Great Britain: Russkii Pravitel'svennyi Komitet v Londone, miscellaneous material including correspondence, reports and lists of military materiel ordered,
France: correspondence, reports and lists of materiel, mostly related to military purchases from French government and French military suppliers,
Rumania: miscellaneous material, mostly related to recovery of Russian military property in Rumania, includes correspondence with French authorities and lists of supplies,
Great Britain: Londonskaia Likvidatsionnaia Komissiia re acquisiton of military supplies in Great Britain and their shipment to Crimea,
Great Britain: Beliaev, Col., re purchase and shipment of aviation supplies from Great Britain for armies of Gen. A. Denikin, Also includes some correspondence re Italy and France
U.S.: correspondenc with Ambassador B. Bakhmetev and Finansovyi Agent S. Ughet re purchase and shipment of military supplies from U.S.,
Upravlenie Rossiiskago Torgovago Flota and others re shipment of military supplies,
Ministerstvo Putei Soobshcheniia and others re supply of railroads in territories newly liberated from the Bolsheviks, Includes reports and memoranda

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Archive of the Russian Military Agent in Constantinople, Lieut.-Gen. G. CHertkov. Includes correspondence and documentary material relating to first period of White Russian emigration. Deals with feeding, housing, employment, medical and other aid to civilian and military refugees, including Gallipoli Detachment and military camp on Lemnos; Pasportno-Propusknoe Otdelenie re judicial matters related to refugees; resettlement of civilian and military refugees in the Balkans and other areas; correspondence with Russian G.H.Q. in Sremski-Karlovci and Russian military agents in other countries; Russian political and social organizations, including officers' clubs; separatist movements: Ukrainian, Cossack and Caucasian; correspondence with Allied High Command in Constantinople and international relief organizations, including Red Cross and A.R.A.; intelligence reports re Bolshevik activity abroad and official investigation of Bolshevik atrocities. Files 52, 53, 55, 81-110, 112-118.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Archive of Informatsionnoe Otdelenie SHtaba; Don, Kuban and Terek Cossacks: correspondence of General Staff with leaders, minutes of meetings, treaty between Cossacks and Baron P. Vrangel'; Kornilovskii Udarnyi Otriad, miscellaneous material; French Occupation Forces in Constantinople: relations with Russian Army in Exile; military service records of officers serving in Russian Army during Civil War. Files 187, 238-249, 251, 313-353.

Ofitserskaia Artilleriiskaia SHkola, Kornilovskii Artilleriiskii Divizion, I-ia Artilleriiskaia Brigada and miscellaneous other artillery units
I-ia Artilleriiskaia Brigada, Kornilovskii Artilleriiskii Divizion, Otdel'nyi Konnyi Generala Alekseeva Divizion and miscellaneous other units

Ofitserskaia Inzhenernaia SHkola, Alekseevskoe Voennoe Uchilishche and other military schools; technical section, including aviation, armored vehicle personnel, radio-telegraph section and corps of military engineers

Perenesenie Prakha Generala Vrangelia v Belgrad, Izdanie Komiteta po uvekovecheniiu pamiati Glavnokomanduiushchago Russkoi Armiei generala barona P.N. Vrangelia, printed copy
6 Oktiabria 1929 goda v g. Belgrade, printed copy

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Perechen' del arkhiva Glavnokomanduiushchago Russkoi armiei generala barona P.N. Vrangelia, otpravlennykh 4 aprelia 1929 na khranenie v Hoover War Library," typescript.

Administrative matters related to Baron P. Vrangel's Government of the Crimea, the evacuation and maintainance of the Russian Army and political matters related to the Russian Army abroad. Includes: minutes of meetings, Osoboe Soveshchanie pri Glavnokomanduiushchem Dobrovol'cheskoi Armii, Osoboe Soveshchanie pri Glavnokomanduiushchem Vooruzhennymi Silami na IUge Rossii and other government bodies, including Soveshchanie...Senatora G.V. Glinki dlia obsuzhdeniia zemel'nago voprosa; diplomatic and other correspondence: Pravitel'stvo IUga Rossii; evacuation, housing and feeding of Russian Army and civilian refugees, including correspondence with French and British authorities; resettlement of military and civilian refugees; Russkii Sovet, miscellaneous material including minutes of meetings; Bulgarian crisis of 1922, miscellaneous material; monarchist organizations: printed matter and correspondence, including Baron P. Vrangel' and Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich; Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich, the Russian National Movement, the Russian Army and Baron P. Vrangel' Administration and financial support of Russian army; activity of Gen.-of-Infantry A. Kutepov; printed matter, especially military newspapers; photographs of military units during first years of emigration, 1918-1925. Files 1-135.

did.unittitle: Osoboe Soveshchanie pri Glavnokomanduiushchem Dobrovol' chskoi Armiei, minutes of meetings (zhurnal) No. typescript, September 28-December 21, 1918
Osoboe Soveshchanie pri Glavnokomanduiushchem Vooruzhennymi Silami na IUge Rossii, minutes of meetings (zhurnal), No. typescript, December 29, 1918-February 22, 1919
Osoboe Soveshchanie pri Glavnokomanduiushchem Vooruzhennymi Silami na IUge Rossii, minutes of meetings (zhurnal), printed copies,
Prikazy Pravitelia IUga Rossii i Glavnokomanduiushchago Russkoi Armiei, Typescript with holograph signatures and handwritten annotations
Sovet pri Glavnokomanduiushchem Vooruzhennymi Silami IUga Rossii, No.

Pravitel'stvo IUga Rossii, diplomatic correspondence, mostly re recognition of Soviet Union by British, French and American governments and negotiations with Poland re united anti-Bolshevik military action, includes correspondence and transcripts of telegrams: Baron P. Vrangel'; Morskoi Predstavitel' Glavnokomanduiushchago V.S.IU.R. pri Soiuznom Komandovanii v Konstantinopole, Capt. O. SHcherbachev; British High Commissioner, Constantinople, Admiral J. de Robeck; British Military Mission, Sebastopol, Gen. Percy; Predsedatel' Soveta Nachal'nikov Upravlenii, A. Krivoshein; Ministr Innostrannykh Del, P. Struve; French Military Mission, Sebastopol, Gen. Mangin; Russian Ambassador in Paris, V. Maklakov; Nachal'nik Upravleniia Inostrannykh Del, G. Trubetskoi; Russian Representative in Constantinople, A. Neratov; Poverennyi v Delakh v Londone, E. Sablin; Rear-Admiral G. Hope; Russian Ambassador in Tokyo; Nachal'nik IAponskoi Voennoi Missii pri Stavke, Maj. Takahasi; Sovetnik Posol'stva v Parizhe, N. de Basili; Président du Conseil, Ministre des Affaires Etrangères, Millerand; Ambassador to Washington, G. Bakhmetev; Comité Militaire Allié de Versailles, Maréchal Foch; Contre-Admiral Dumesnil; Senior Russian Diplomatic Representative Abroad, M. Girs; M. Paléologue; Lieut.-Gen. A. Lukomskii; S. Sazonov; A. Tyrkova-Williams. Typescript and holograph,

Soveshchanie obrazovanoe pod predsedatel'stvom Senatora G.V. Glinki dlia obsuzhdeniia zemel'nago voprosa po prikazaniiu Glavnokomanduiushchago V.S.IU.R...
Includes: minutes of meetings (zhurnal); dissenting opinions of committee members; drafts of resolutions and projects; newspaper clippings ( Tavricheskii Golos, IUzhnyia Vedomosti, Vechernii Kurier); "Prikaz Glavnokomanduiushchago Vooruzhennymi Silami na IUge Rossii o Zemle ot 25 maia goda," printed copy; report, "Svedeniia ob osushchestvlenii zemel'nago zakona Generala Vrangelia 25 maia 1920 goda k 15-mu oktiabria," typescript and handwritten
Russian property evacuated by Pravitel'stvo IUga Rossii to Constantinople and delivered into the safekeeping of the French government,

Correspondence: Baron P. Vrangel' to Comte de Martel, Haut Commissaire de France and Admiral Dumesnil; A. Neratov to Haut-Commissaire de France à Constantinople, A. Defrance; A. Defrance and A. Neratov; P. Struve to Ministre des Affaires Etrangères, G. Leygues; Président du Conseil, Commission de Liquidation Russe, Clairebont to P. Struve. Includes transcripts of telegrams between A. Neratov, E. Sablin, V. Maklakov and Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov, typescript; excerpt, "Liquidation du Compte Wrangel," Le Temps, ; official lists of supplies and equipment under dispute, includes: "Vedomost' imushchestvu sostoiashchemu na uchete v nastoiashchee vremia s ukazaniem primerno stoimosti vo frankakh"; "Vedomost' khlebnym produktam v zerne i pererabotannym pribyvshim iz Kryma 9 Ianvaria, 1921"; "Spisok transportov Morskogo Vedomstva"; "Spisok katrov i buksirov M.V."; "Vedomost' predmetam artilleriiskago imushchestva vziatago frantsuzami u Russkoi Armii"; "Vedomost' intendantskomu imushchestvu..."; "Barzhi, podchalki i pontony rechnoi transportnoi flotilii," typescript and handwritten

Evacuation, housing and feeding of Russian Army and civilian refugees, mostly at Gallipoli and Lemnos; negotiations with Allies re future of Russian Army and civilian refugees including resettlement in Europe or South America and repatriation to Soviet Union; conflicts between Russian Army and French military authorities, typescript,

Correspondence: Baron P. Vrangel', including appeals to international community and orders to Russian Army; Chief of Staff, G.H.Q., Russian Army, Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov; Chef du Service de Santé et de Secours aux Réfugies Russes, S. Il'ine...
Russian Mission in Greece, P. Demidov; Comité de Secours russe de l'Union des membres des Villes et Zemstvos à l'étranger, Prince L'vov; Russkii Parlamentskii Komitet v Konstantinopole, I. Aleksinskii; Rossiiskoe Obshchestvo Krasnago Kresta; Corps d'Occupation de Constantinople, Etat-Major, Gen. Nayral de Bourgon; Escadre de Mediterranée Orientale, Vice-Admiral De Bon; A. Defrance...
Commandant le Corps d'Occupation de Constantinople, Gen. C. Charpy; Ministère des Affaires Etrangères, Aristide Briand; Haut Commissariat de la République Française, Service Politique, Gen. Pelle; American Red Cross; transcripts of telegrams between P. Struve, A. Neratov, V. Maklakov, M. Girs, also A. Guchkov to H. Hoover, President W. Harding, and Secretary of State Hughes; recruitment of Russian military personnel into French Foreign Legion; transport of military and civilian refugees from Hademkeuy-Tchataldja camps to Gallipoli and Lemnos; reports re composition, condition, feeding and housing of troops and civilian refugees on Gallipoli and Lemnos, including correspondence and orders of Le Commandant d'Armes, Ile de Lemnos, Gen. Broussaud, Komandir Kubanskogo Korpusa Gen. M. Fostikov and Komandir Donskogo Korpusa, Lieut.-Gen. F. Abramov; Russian Naval Squadron in Bizerte; repatriation of Cossacks to Soviet Union, specifically aboard French vessel "Reshid-Pasha"; French project for settlement of refugees in France, Brazil, Peru and Madagascar; report re "Selimie" Camp

Maintainance of Russian Army and civilian refugees, mostly problem of resettlement and repatriation including negotiations between Russian government in exile, French government and governments of Bulgaria, Czechoslovakia and Serbia. Deals most specifically with situation in refugee camp on Island of Lemnos, typescript and handwritten,

Correspondence: Baron P. Vrangel' to Marshalls of France Foch, Joffre, Pétain et al. and Haut Commissaire à Constantinople, Gen. Pelle; Russian Military Agent, Bulgaria, Lieut.-Gen. A. Viazmitinov; A. Maklakov; Russian Military Agent in Constantinople, Lieut.-Gen. G. CHertkov; Russian Military Agent in Czechoslovakia Lieut.-Gen. M. Leontiev; Russian Military Agent Czechoslovakia, Maj.-Gen. D. Pototskii; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov; Lieut.-Gen. P. Kusonskii; Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller; Russian Diplomatic Representative in Czechoslovakia, V. SHtrandtman; A. Neratov, including appeals to British, American and Italian governments... M. Girs; P. Demidov; S. Il'in; G. Bakhmetev; A. Guchkov; Maréchal Foch to Baron P. Vrangel'; Gen. C. Charpy; American Red Cross, C. Claflin Davis; British High Commission, Constantinople, Horace Rumpold; Haut Commisariat du Japon, S. Uchida; "Ofitsial'noe Soobshchenie SHtaba Glavnokomanduiushchago Russkoi Armiei"; address "To the President of the United States" and "V Sovet Ligi Natsii"... reports of refugees re situation in Soviet Union; Lemnos, orders and correspondence of Gens. Broussaud, Fostikov, Abramov and others especially re conflicts between French authorities and Russian officers; fate of returnees aboard "Reshid-Pasha"; use of force by French military authorities in repatriation procedures; resettlement of refugees (French project); report, "Kratkii raschet stoimosti soderzhaniia Russkoi Armii v Serbii"; report, General-of-Infantry, A. Kutepov re refugees sent to Brazil aboard French vessel "Rion"; report, "Selimie" refugee camp; list of military personnel sent to Bulgaria
Resettlement of Russian Army and refugees primarily in Serbia, Bulgaria and Hungary, typescript and handwritten,

Correspondence: Baron P. Vrangel' (including letter to Herbert Hoover, Henry Ford and Sir Winston Churchill with holograph reply); S. Il'in; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov; Maj.-Gen. D. Pototskii; Lieut-Gen. M. Leontiev; Lieut.-Gen. A. Viazmitinov, including letter to Nachal'nik SHtaba Bolgarskoi Armii, Topaldzhikov; E. Demidov; A. Neratov; V. Shtrandtman; Russian Diplomatic Representative in Bulgaria, A. Petriaev; Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller; Lieut.-Gen. P. Kusonskii; Russian Military Agent in Hungary, Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe; Gen. Pelle; Contre-Admiral Dumesnil; S. Uchida; Sir C.H. Harrington; French Commander, Gallipoli, Lieut.-Col. Thomassin; High Commissioner for the Relief of Russian Refugees, Fridhof Nansen; Deputy High Commissioner for the Care of Russian Refugees, Sir Samuel Hoare; Lemnos, evacuation of camp, orders of Gens. Broussaud, Abramov and Fostikov; Serebriakov and recruitment of Cossacks for work in Baku and Greece; reports re conflicts between French and Russian military authorities at Lemnos and Gallipoli; report, "Svedeniia o chisle ubyvshikh s o. Lemnosa v period s 27 po 7 sen. 1921"; "Selimie" refugee camp; report, "Primernyia svedeniia o chislennom sostave voennykh lagerei k 7 iiunia 1921"...
Report, "Statisticheskiia svedeniia o chislenosti russkikh voisk i russkikh bezhentsev v voennykh i granzhdanskikh lageriakh..."; report of Baron P. Vrangel' to League of Nations and appeals to International and American Red Cross; report of Gen. S. KHadzhich to Serbian Council of Ministers; poster, address of French military authorities to Russian refugees
Russkii Sovet, minutes of meetings (zhurnaly zasedanii), Vol. I, No. typescript, April 5-September 16, 1921
Russkii Sovet, same as above, Vol. II, No. 7, typescript, September 16, 1921-September 20, 1922
Russkii Sovet, "Materialy k zhurnalam zasedanii Russkago Soveta i zhurnaly zasedanii Komissii Russkago Soveta," Vol. III, Part I, typescript,
Russkii Sovet, "Materialy k zhurnalam zasedanii Russkago Soveta i zhurnaly zasedanii Komissii Russkago Soveta," Vol. III, Part II, typescript,

Russkii Sovet, miscellaneous material, includes: correspondence and minutes of meetings re its formation; correspondence with various organizations and political parties including, Konstantinopol'skii Politicheskii Ob"edinennyi Komitet, Narodnaia Monarchicheskaia Partiia, Ob"edinennyi Sovet Dona, Kubani i Tereka, Biuro Vremennago Russkago Komiteta Natsional'nago Ob"edineniia, Partiia Narodnoi Svobody, Biuro s"ezdov predstavitelei bezhenskikh organizatsiiv...S.KH.S., Sobranie Zemskikh i Gorodskikh Glasnykh vo Frantsii and others; correspondence of individuals including, Baron P. Vrangel', I. Aleksinskii, N. CHaikovskii, V. SHul'gin, Lieut.-Gen. Tolstov, Sir Samuel Hoare, S. Il'in, V . Musin-Pushkin; newspaper clippings including, Obshchee Delo, Novaia Russkaia Zhizn', Posledniia Novosti, Novoe Vremia, Presse du soir; pamphlets published by Russkii Sovet: Russkii Sovet, K Voprosu o Russkoi Armii, printed copies, Paris, 1921; international relations, address of Baron P. Vrangel' and Russkii Sovet to Velikaia Serbskaia Skupshchina and Bolgarskoe Narodnoe Sobranie; "Memorandum" from Russkii Sovet to Allies re Genoa Conference; "Communique de l'agence Havas, l'attitude du General Wrangel" and "Réponse du Conseil Russe au communiqué français..."; correspondence, Ruski Drzhavni Punomoenik za smeshtaj ruskikh izbeglitsa u Kral'evstvu Srba, KHrvatai i Slovenatsa; financial matters related to maintainance of Russian Army; miscellaneous material re S"ezd Russkago Natsional'nago Ob"edineniia v Parizhe; typescript and handwritten,

Sinking of the yacht "Lucullus": expressions of sympathy addressed to Baron P. Vrangel' by Russian emigre organizations and individuals and Vrangel's personal replies; newsaper clippings, Presse du soir, Russkoe Delo, Posledniia Novosti, Obshchee Delo, typescript and handwritten,

Addresses, resolutions and greetings of Russian emigre organizations to Baron P. Vrangel', includes: protests against French plans to repatriate refugees to Soviet Union or resettle them in Brazil, ; farewell addesses of emigre communities in Serbia on occasion of Vrangel's departure for Belgium, November 1926; miscellaneous; typescript and handwritten, 1921-1928

Bulgarian crisis, 1922, includes: correspondence of Baron P. Vrangel'; Chief of Staff of Bulgarian Army Col. Topaldzhikov; Russian Military Agent; Lieut.-Gen. A. Viazmitinov; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov,; Lieut.-Gen. P. Kusonskii; Gen. I. Ronzhin; Lieut.-Gen. Vitkovskii; A. Petriaev; A. Tyrkova-Williams; Sofiiskii Natsional'nyi Soiuz; reports re internal political situation in Bulgaria, including "Zhurnal soveshchaniia s bolgarskimi deiateliami, 28 marta 1922 g."; miscellaneous material re Bulgarian order to disarm Russian contingents; excerpts from Bulgarian newspapers; address of Baron P. Vrangel' to Bulgarian Council of Ministers; Col. Samokhvalov affair, including report re his arrest; miscellaneous reports re conflicts between Bulgarian authorities and Russian refugees, typescript and handwritten,

Bulgarian crisis, includes: correspondence, same as above; protocol of Verkhovnyi Administrativnyi Sovet (Bulgarian); Russkii Natsional'nyi Komitet: information bulletin and letter to Chairman of Bulgarian Council of Ministers, Stambuliiskii; excerpts from Bulgarian newspapers; reports re Soviet-Bulgarian negotiations at Genoa Conference; miscellaneous reports re conflicts between Bulgarian authorities and Russian refugees; atrocitis committed against Russian refugees; Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller's mission, including correspondence with Bulgarian authorities; reports re internal political situation in Bulgaria, including activity of Bulgarian communists and Soviet agents; letters of support to Baron P. Vrangel' from Russian social organizations; typescript and handwritten, June 6, 1922-February 5, 1923

Bulgarian crisis, includes: correspondence, Baron P. Vrangel', Gen. I. Ronzhin, Lieut.-Gen. P. Kusonskii, Don Ataman A. Bogaevskii; newspaper clippings and excerpts from Bulgarian press... Reports re Bulgarian coup of June 9, 1923; participation of Russian army in military action following coup, general and local reports; list of Russian officers expelled from Bulgaria, 1922; "Doklad Gospodinu Ministru Vnutrennikh Del i Narodnago Zdraviia" re atrocities committed by previous government against Russian army and refugees; typescript and handwritten, June 10, 1923-August 10, 1924

Nikolai Nikolaevich, Grand Duke of Russia, his leadership of the Russian National Movement and his relationship to Baron P. Vrangel' and the Russian Army, Vol. I, includes: correspondence, Baron P. Vrangel', S. Il'in, Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen, A. Lukomskii, Col. A. von Lampe, N. CHebyshev, P. Struve, IU. Danilov; Lieut.-Gen. P. Kusonskii, I. Aleksinskii, S. Tretiakov, P. Dolgorukov, G. CHertkov, Lieut.- Gen. P. SHatilov, IA. IUzefovich, Baron Stal', Count V. Kokovtsev, I. Nazhivin, Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller, A. Trepov, P, Gendrikov, A. Kartashev, Maj.-Gen. L. Artifeksov, N. Markov; summary of speech, N. Markov; minutes of meeting, Russkii Natsional'nyi Komitet v Parizhe, ; clippings, emigre press; typescript and handwritten, November 3, 1921-July 26, 1923

Same as above, Vol. II; correspondence, same as above and N. Savich, M. Kedrov; clippings, emigre press... Miscellaneous material: Narodno-Monarkhicheskii Soiuz, Vysshyi Monarkhicheskii Sovet, Natsional'noe Ob"edinenie, Cossacks (including Ataman A. Bogaevskii); minutes of meetings: Russkii Natsional'nyi Komitet v Parizhe, ; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov, "Zapiska o rabote po podgotovke rukovodstvui osushchestvleniiu sverzhenii sovetskoi vlasti v Rossii" and other reports re meetings of emigre political groups in Paris working to create united national front under leadership of Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich; minutes of meetings: I. Aleksinskii plan, Paris, August 1923; typescript and handwritten, July 2-September 10, 1923

Same as above, Vol. III, conflict between Russian Army (Baron P. Vrangel') and various branches of monarchist movement (Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich and Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich); correspondence, same as above and Metropolitan Antonii (KHrapovitskii), Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich, P. Krasnov, Prince S. Ol'denburg; Russian monarchist organizations, miscellaneous printed matter, appeals and pamphlets (includes, P. Krasnov, "Otkrytoe pis'mo kazakam"); clippings, emigre press; typescript and handwritten,

Same as above, Vol. IV, conflict between Russian Army and monarchist movement; correspondence, same as above and Gen. of Infantry A. Kutepov; protocol: meeting of Imperial Family, Paris, ; open letter, Russkoe Patrioticheskoe Ob"edinenie v Parizhe; orders to Russian Army: Baron P. Vrangel'; minutes of meeting and protokol, Obshchee Sobranie Soiuza Russkikh ofitserov uchastnikov voiny, Paris, January 20, 1924; typescript and handwritten, December 3, 1923-February 19, 1924

Same as above, Vol. V, conflict between Russian Army and monarchist movement; correspondence, same as above, especially re relationship of Russian Army and Baron P. Vrangel' to Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich; includes report of Baron P. Vrangel' to Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich re creation of R.O.V.S. and financial statement re expenditures of Russian Army; list of Russian military regalia on deposit in Fortress of Belgrade; clippings, emigre press (also includes interview given by Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich to American press); printed matter, tearsheets: "Soiuz Russkikh Ofitserov"; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov: reports re political situation in emigre community, especially Paris; "Dokladnaia zapiska" presented to Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich by Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen; funds in keeping of Gen. Podtiagin; conflict between Baron P. Vrangel' and Gen. of Infantry A. Kutepov; orders to Russian Army: Baron P. Vrangel', includes order re formation of R.O.V.S.; "TSirkuliarnoe pis'mo Velikago Kniazia Andreiia Vladimirovicha," printed copy... Open letters, typescript and printed copies: Mariia Fedorovna, Empress of Russia and Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich re pretentions to the throne of Grand Duke Kirill Vladimirovich; typescript and handwritten,

Russian Army abroad, Vol. I; correspondence, Baron P. Vrangel', Gen.-of-Infantry A. Kutepov, Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller, Lieut.-Gen. F. Abramov, Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov, Maj.-Gen. Naumenko, Lieut.-Gen. A. Viazmitinov; Lieut.-Gen. IA. Slashchev-Krymskii affair... reports re composition, housing and maintainance of Russian Army (includes Gallipoli Detachment), also "Boevoi Sostav Russkoi Armii k 18 Dekabria 1920" and same for January 30, 1921 and May 1921, list of arms in possession of Russian Army, January 1921); "Otchet Nachal'nika eshelona parakhoda 'Saratov' s 14 Noiabria 1920 po 10 Fevralia 1921"; report, "Prebyvanie Glavnokomanduiushchago v Gallipoli i na Lemnose"; report re conditions for emigration in Balkans and elsewhere; Russian contingents as border guards in Serbia: negotiations, conditions and maps indicating deployment, reports of Military Agent in Serbia, Maj.-Gen. D. Pototskii; transfer of troops to Bulgaria: negotiations and reports re conditions; Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen, report, "Sovremennoe polozhenie russkago ofitserstva v Germanii"; I-ia pekhotnaia diviziia "Smert'"; typescript and handwritten, November 6, 1920-December 29, 1921

Russian Army abroad, Vol. III; correspondence: Baron P. Vrangel', General-of-Infantry A. Kutepov, Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller, Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov, Gen. N. Kiselevskii, Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen, Lieut.-Gen. F. Abramov, Lieut.-Gen. P. Kondzerovskii, Lieut.-Gen. A. Lukomskii; miscellaneous material: proposed participation of Russian military in case of political unrest in Paris; financial questions, especially related to Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich and the financing of R.O.V.S., includes reports, "Doklad o sredstvakh peredannykh Glavnokomanduiushchim Russkoi Armiei Generalom Vrangelem v rasporiazhenie Vashego Imperatorskago Vysochestva" and "O sokrashchenii smety na soderzhenie Upravleniia...," also lists of financial assets of Russian Army; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov: reports re political activity of emigre circles in Paris; miscellaneous material re conflicts between Baron P. Vrangel' and Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich; transfer and employment of Russian Army personnel from Bulgaria to France; relationship of army to Petr Struve's Vozrozhdenie; typescript and handwritten,

Russian Army abroad, Vol. IV; correspondence: Baron P. Vrangel', Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller, Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov, Lieut.-Gen. A. Lukomskii, Lieut.-Gen. F. Abramov, Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen, Lieut.-Gen. P. Kondzerovskii; miscellaneous material re conflicts between Baron P. Vrangel' and Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich ; miscellaneous material re financing of Russian Army and R.O.V.S., includes financial reports and lists of disbursements; report: Maj.-Gen. L. Artifeksov re living conditions of Russian contingents in Bulgaria; miscellaneous material re participation of Russian Army in Zarubezhnyi S"ezd; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov: reports re political activity in preparation of Zarubezhnyi S"ezd; transfer of Russian army units from Bulgaria to Belgium (C. Fricero contract); report re history and purpose of Russian Army abroad... Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen: report re condition of Russian Army contingents in Poland and the Baltic States; typescript and handwritten,

Russian Army abroad, Vol. V; correspondence, Baron P. Vrangel', Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov, Lieut.-Gen. F. Abramov, Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller, A. Ostrogradskii, Lieut.-Gen. A. Lukomskii, Gen.-of-Infantry A. Kutepov, Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich, Lieut.-Gen. P. Kondzerovskii, M. Girs, Lieut.-Gen. P. Kusonskii; "Prikaz Generala Vrangelia No. 6," printed copy; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov: reports re political activity of emigre circles in Paris, especially in connection with Zarubezhnyi S"ed; miscellaneous material re financial situation of Russian Army and R.O.V.S., and especially their financing by Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich; R.O.V.S.: membership lists; typescript and handwritten, January 12-October 26, 1926

Russian Army abroad, Vol. VI; correspondence, Baron P. Vrangel', Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller, Lieut.-Gen. P. Kondzerovskii, Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov, Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen, Lieut.-Gen. F. Abramov, Lieut.-Gen. P. Kusonskii, M. Girs, Gen.-of-Infantry A. Kutepov, Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe, Lieut.-Gen. I. Barbovich; miscellaneous material re financial situation of Russian Army and R.O.V.S., especially financial support of Baron P. Vrangel' and his staff; Baron P. Vrangel': orders to R.O.V.S; staff headquarters; information communiques; miscellaneous material re conflicts between Baron P. Vrangel' and Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich; miscellaneous material re activity of Gen-of-Infantry A. Kutepov and his relationship to Baron P. Vrangel'; typescript and handwritten,

Russian Army abroad, Vol. VII; correspodence, Baron P. Vrangel', Lieut.-Gen. P. Kusonskii, Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov, Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller, Lieut.-Gen. F. Abramov, Gen.-of-Infantry A. Kutepov, Lieut.-Gen. I. Barbovich, S. Paleolog, Lieut.-Gen. Vitkovskii, Lieut.-Gen. A. Lukomskii, Lieut.-Gen. P. Kondzerovskii, Gen.-of-Infantry Ekk, V. Davats, Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe, Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen; miscellaneous material re financial situation of R.O.V.S. and staff officers; Russkii Voennyi Vestnik and "Eurasianism" (Rklitskii affair); Baron P. Vrangel' re "Bratstvo Russkoi Pravdy" and "Trest"; staff headquarters: information communiques; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov: reports re political acitivity of emigre circles in Paris; Baron P. Vrangel': report to Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich re R.O.V.S.; typescript and handwritten,

Correspondence between Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich and Baron P. Vrangel', also includes: "Obrashchenie Velikago Kniazia Nikolaia Nikolaevicha k russkim liudiam"; "Soobshchenie," No. 1-14; greetings addressed to Grand Duke by Zarubezhnyi S"ezd and his answer; newspaper clippings re Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich and monarchist cause (including press interviews), typescript, handwritten and printed matter,

Political correspondence, Vol. I; Baron P. Vrangel'; P. Krasnov, including interview; Lieut.-Gen. A. Bogaevskii; V. Burtsev; Ob"edinennyi Sovet Dona, Kubani i Tereka; M. Bernatskii; Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller; Lieut.-Gen. P. Makhrov; P. Struve; Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen; Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov; N. Savin; A. Guchkov; D. Grimm; Gen. Podtiagin; S. Il'in... B. Savinkov (Russkii Evakuatsionnyi Komitet v Pol'she): report to French government, also other material re situation of Russian Army and refugees in Poland and correspondence with Baron P. Vrangel'; report re position and composition of Third Army, Army of Maj.-Gen. S. Bulak-Balakhovich and Armiia Ukrainskoi Narodnoi Respubliki; "Polozhenie o Russkom Delovom Kabinete v Parizhe"; miscellaneous material re Cossacks, including Astrakhanskoe Kazach'e Voisko, Kalmytskaia CHast'; Politicheskaia CHast' pri Glavnokomanduiushchem R.A.; Paris, A. Guchkov: reports re political situation, including internal politics of emigre circles and relations with foreign governments; Politicheskii Ob"edinennyi Komitet and P. IUrenev: correspondence and "Otkrytoe pis'mo k obshchestvennomu mneniiu Evropy i Ameriki"; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov: circular letter re situation of Russian Army; Rossiiskii Zemsko-Gorodskoi Komitet Pomoshchi Bezhentsam: "Obshchiia Polozheniia" and correspondence S. KHripunov and V. Zeeler; Ataman Semenov: "Appel aux Peuple du Monde" and "K Narodam Rossii i k Russkim Liudiam," printed leaflets, also correspondence with Baron P. Vrangel' and miscellaneous other material re situation in the Far East; Rossiiskii Finansovo-Promyshlenno-Torgoyi Soiuz; S"ezd Russkago Natsional'nago Ob"edineniia: miscellaneous material, including correspondence of A. Kartashev; miscellaneous material Russian Navy; greetings addressed to Baron P. Vrangel' by emigre organizations; petition to Baron P. Vrangel' from paricipants of Kronstadt Rebellion (1921); typescript, handwritten and printed matter,

Political correspondence, Vol. II; Baron P. Vrangel'; Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller (includes report re B. Savinkov and information re N. Sokolov's investigation of death of Imperial Family); Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe; Lieut.-Gen. A. Lukomskii (includes copy of original report re murder of Imperial Family made by eyewitness first arriving at scene, Esaul Tiaguntsov, also report: "Russkaia Armiia na chuzhbine"); A. Guchkov, including reports re political situation; P. Krasnov; S. Il'in (including letter to A. Dulles, American Embassy in Constantinople); Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov; V. SHtrandtman; Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen (includes information re situation of emigres in Germany); P. Struve; Lieut.-Gen. A. Bogaevskii (includes material re relationship of Baron P. Vrangel' to cossack forces); D. Grimm (includes report re Kronstadt sailors); A. Polunin: report re Nansen-CHicherin agreement; B. Bakhmetev; Mitropolit Antonii, Kievskii i Galitskii (re church sobor); S. Paleolog; V. Nikol'skii; A. Amfiteatrov; A. Kartashev; Lieut.-Gen. P. Glazenap; A. Trepov; N. Savin; greetings addressed to Baron P. Vrangel' by emigre organizations... "Zaiavlenie Generala Vrangelia," printed leaflet; Russkoe Zagranichnoe TSerkovnoe Sobranie, Sremski Karlovci: list of participants, report of N. L'vov and other miscellaneous material; League of Nations: "Memorandum po voprosu o russkikh bezhentsakh," F. Nansen and other material dealing with Russian refugees; "Ko vsemm russkim soldatam...," re Gen. Slashchev-Krymskii; "Ot Russkago Natsional'nago Komiteta, Russkago Parlamentskago Komiteta i Sobraniia Zemskikh i Gorodskikh Glasnykh v Parizhe," re Cannes Conference; typescript and handwritten, July 28, 1921-February 23, 1922

Political correspondence, Vol. III; Baron P. Vrangel'; S. Il'in; N. Savich: report re Russian Navy (Dobrovol'cheskii Flot); A. Guchkov, including reports re political situation; Bezpartiinaia Konferentsiia Russkikh Rabochikh: report; Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller; A. Trepov; G. Glinka; P. Krupenskii; I. Nazhivin; Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe; A. Tyrkova-Williams; A. Kartashev: "Vpechatlenie o Poezdke v Gallipoli," lecture delivered to Londonskii Otdel Natsional'nago Soiuza and also correspondence; N. CHebyshev; E. Demidov; Prince G. Leikhtenbergskii; Russian civic organizations in Paris, including Parlamentskii Komitet: letter to Secretary of State of U.S.; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov; Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen, includes reports re political groups; N. Markov and Vysshii Monarkhicheskii Sovet: miscellaneous material; P. Makhrov; Konferentsiia Russkago narodno-monarkhicheskago Soiuza miscellaneous material; Mitropolit Evlogii, "Zavedyvaiushchii russkimi pravoslavnymi TSerkvami zagranitsei"; E. Sablin; I. Aleksinskii...
Sovet Nitstskago Monarkhicheskago Obshchestva: minutes of meetings; N. Tretiakov; TSentral'nyi Komitet Belorusskikh...organizatsii; IU. Savinkov; Hungary: V. SHtrandtman and Esaul Ilovaiskii (Russian Military Agent in Budapest) includes miscellaneous material re Kalmyks, Astrakhan Cossacks, Prince Tundutov and L. Kazem Bek (Monarchist Union of Hungary); V. Burtsev and Obshchee Delo, including financial matters; D. Grimm; Soedinennoe Biuro Zemskikh i Gorodskikh glasnykh v Konstantinopole: report re Russian refugees in Constantinople; greetings addressed to Baron P. Vrangel'; IU. Danilov; typescript and handwritten,

Political correspondence, Vol. IV; Baron. P. Vrangel'; S. Il'in, including report re Russkii Sovet; I. Aleksinskii; Vsezagranichnyi TSerkovnyi Sobor, Sremski Karlovci, miscellaneous material; V. Burtsev and Obshchee Delo; Vysshii Monarkhicheskii Sovet, including material re "CHrezvychainoe Zasedanie," Paris, ; miscellaneous material... A. Trepov; Russkii Natsional'nyi Komitet, Paris: open letters, resolutions and other miscellaneous material; Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen, includes material re relationship with American press; S. Paleolog; IU. Danilov; Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe; protests of Don, Kuban and Terek Cossacks against F. Nansen repatriation plan; report: "Amerikantsy o Rossii"; P. Krasnov; I. Aleksinskii; B. Brazol, report: "Deiatel'nost' Russkikh Monarkhicheskikh Organizatsii v S.SH.A."; IU. Lodyzhenskii and Rossiiskoe Obshchestvo Krasnago Kresta; Mitropolit Evlogii; Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller, including financial matters; A. Neratov; report re activity of A. Bakhmetev; A. Savich; V. SHtrandtman; A. Guchkov; A. IUgorskii, "Ocherednaia Zadacha Russkago Natsional'nago Dvizheniia"; A. Kartashev; Mezhdunarodnoe Biuro Truda: report re Russian refugees; report re Bolshevik take-over of Vladivostok: "V Osoboe Soveshchanie Rossiiskago Obshchestva Krasnago Kresta na D/Vostoke"; A. KHripunov; Soveshchanie Predstavitelei Russkikh Obshchestvennykh Organizatsii v Sofii: protocol; Russkii Komitet v Turtsii: open letter, printed copy; Italy: miscellaneous material re contacts with Fascist circles; M. Girs, including financial matters, especially Russian monies held by Bulgarian government; Zemsko-Gorodskoi Soiuz (Zemgor), miscellaneous material; typescript and handwritten, August 25, 1922-July 7, 1923

Political correspondence, Vol. V; Baron P. Vrangel'; Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe, including "Zapiska ob otnoshenii russkikh pravykh monarkhicheskikh organizatsii k russkoi armii"; A. Ladyzhenskii; S. Paleolog; A. Guchkov; D. Grimm; Lieut.-Gen. E.Klimovich, secret report: "Proekt platformy soiuza respublikanskikh-demokraticheskikh organizatsii"... Soiuz Russkikh Ofitserov...v...S.KH.S.," address to Baron P. Vrangel'; N. Tal'berg; N. CHebyshev; P. Krasnov; A. Trepov; P. Skarzhinskii; V. Burtsev; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov; I. Aleksinskii and Russkii Komitet v Turtsii; I. Il'in: political project; M. Girs; Germany (Bavaria): miscellaneous material re relationship of Russian emigre community (Gen. V. Biskupskii) to political situation; lists of recipients of "Gallipoli Album"; I. Il'in: transcript of lecture, "Gosudarstvennyi smysl Beloi Armii" and correspondence; Vysshii Monarkhicheskii Sovet: report re trip through Balkans and Bessarabia and other material; A. Kartashev and Russkii Natsional'nyi Komitet; V. Nikol'skii; Lieut.-Gen. M. Fostikov; V. Gurko; V. SHul'gin; E. Sablin; IU. Danilov; N. Savich; Delegatskoe Sobranie Narodno-Monarkhicheskago Soiuza, miscellaneous material; Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen: reports re attempts to create emigre union in Paris; B. Ivanitskii and Rosiiskoe Obshchestvo Krasnago Kresta... P. Miliukov, transcript of lecture: "O Belom Dvizhenii"; V. Burtsev and Obshchee Delo; A. Tyrkova-Williams; A. KHripunov; P. Dolgorukov: report re his attempted penetration into Soviet Union; Soiuz Russkikh Ofitserov Uchastnikov Velikoi Voiny, printed open letter; Gen. N. Baratov and Soiuz Russkikh Invalidov; Mitropolit Antonii: "Poslanie k Russkoi armii..."; typescript and handwritten,

Political correspondence, Vol. VI; Baron P. Vrangel', includes printed leaflet: "K narodu russkomu slovo o Russkoi Armii"; N. Savich; Lieut.-Gen. A von Lampe; P. Aleksinskii; Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen; I. Aleksinskii; B. Gershel'man; A. Guchkov; N. L'vov; A. Fedorov; Lieut.-Gen. P. Kondzerovskii on behalf of Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich; newpaper clippings, mostly re monarchist politics: Novoe Vremia, Rodina, Posledniia Novosti, Vechernee Vremia, Ruskaia Gazeta, Dni, Rul', Rus', Russkaia Gazeta, Za Svobodu, Vozrozhdenie, Parizhskii Vestnik; Lieut.-Gen. A. Kutepov; translation of interview with Daily Telegraph: "Velikii Kniaz; Nikolai o budushchem Rossii..."; B. Gagarin re legitimist monarchist politics; N. Markov and Vysshii Monarkhicheskii Sovet; A. KHripunov and Vnepartiinoe Natsional'noe Ob"edinenie Russkikh v Germanii; Lieut.-Gen. V. SHtrandtman; Prince G. Leikhtenbergskii and Soiuz Ob"edinennykh Monarkhistov, includes printed party program; A. Trepov, includes speech given at Paris Conference, ; S. Paleolog; N. CHebyshev; M. Domrachev and Komitet Monarkhicheskikh Organizatsii Dal'niago Vostoka, miscellaneous material; P. Dolgorukov; I. Il'in; V. SHul'gin; typescript and handwritten, December 20, 1924-January 7, 1926

Political correspondence, Vol. VII; Baron P. Vrangel', includes miscellaneous newspaper clippings re his move to Belgium; Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen; Lieut.-Gen. A. Lukomskii; Prince G. Leikhtenbergskii; P. Struve; newspaper clippings: Vozrozhdenie; anonymous: "Sovremennaia Rossiia (lichnyia vpechatleniia)"; C. Fricero; L. Semenovskii; V. SHul'gin; M. Domrachev and Komitet Monarkhicheskikh Organizatsii Dal'niago Vostoka; I. Uvarov, Petrogradskaia Ssudnaia Kazna and financing of Russian Army; N. CHebyshev; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov; A. Tyrkova-Williams; Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller; V. Davats, Gody: clippings of reviews from miscellaneous newspapers; Soiuz Invalidov and General-of-Cavalry N. Baratov; S. Paleolog; I. Aleksinskii; V. Davats; newpaper clipping: L'Humanité (re Russian workers); Lieut.-Gen. von Lampe, includes miscellaneous material re "Kenkel Affair"; V. Malama, re "Legitimist" intrigues in Hungary; N. CHebyshev; A. Aleksinskii; newspaper clippings: miscellaneous material re Russkii Komitet S.KH.S.; Lieut.-Gen. A. Bogaevskii: open letter to Cossacks; typescript and handwritten,

Political correspondence, Vol. VIII; Baron P. Vrangel', includes miscellaneous newspaper clippings re Vrangel' and interviews with him; N. CHebyshev; I. Uvarov and financial matters; Lieut.-Gen. A. Lukomskii, Lieut.-Gen. A. Bogaevskii, Grand Duke Nikolai Nikolaevich and Cossacks; P. Struve; IU. Lodyzhenskii; S. Paleolog; I. Davats; S. Merkulov; Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe; A. Guchkov; Lieut.-Gen. E. Klimovich; A. Aleksinskii; N. Savich; V. SHul'gin; Prince G. Leikhtenbergskii; M. Domrachev and Komitet Monarkhicheskikh Organizatsii Dal'niago Vostoka; newspaper clippings re Russian fleet in Bizerte; Lieut.-Gen. I. KHolmnsen; Hungary: V. Malama, "Legitimist" intrigues, relations with Hungarian government and Vrangel''s visit; A. KHripunov; L. Semenovskii; typescript and handwritten,

Correspondence of Baron P. Vrangel' with foreigners and clippings from foreign newspapers; Major Takahashi (Japanese Military Mission in Constantinople); Admiral G. de Robeck; Sir C. Harrington; M. Horthy; C. Rivet; S. Hoare; Gen. Pelle; T. Aubert (Entente Internationale Contre la IIIe Internationale); C. Fricero; Lord S. Sydenham; Vice-Admiral L. Exelmans; J. Laroche; H. Williams; C. Huszar; G. Pachitch; deposition of Baron P. Vrangel' in case of "Herman Bernstein vs. Henry Ford and the Dearborn Publishing Co." (Baron P. Vrangel' and anti-Semitism); Gen. J. Percy; miscellaneous correspondence Vrangel' family (German branch); typescript and handwritten,

Miscellaneous correspondence; Baron P. Vrangel'; report re Gallipoli and Gen. of Infantry A. Kutepov; E. Balabanov; obituaries: S. Il'in and V. Nabokov; Mitropolit Antonii KHrapovitskii; P. Orlov; miscellaneous material: case of P. Persianov vs. Baron P. Vrangel'(Serbian Court); N. CHebyshev re D. Nikiforov affair; Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe; Baron A. Tiesenhausen and Russko-Slavianskii Bank; micellaneous material re building of Russian Church in Belgrade; W. Antonoff & A. Tchebycheff, Avocats Internationaux and attempts to instigate legal proceedings against Russian Army; typescript and handwritten,

Personal correspondence as Commander-in-Chief; Baron P. Vrangel'; letter of condolence on death of A. Krivoshein and Gen. Pokrovskii; M. Girs; Lieut.-Gen. P. SHatilov; Lieut.-Gen. A. Lukomskii; Mitropolit Antonii KHrapovitskii; Prince G. Leikhtenbergskii; P. Rodzianko; Sovet Obshchestva popecheniia o dukhovnykh nuzhdakh...v S.KH.S.: protocol; Baron Vrangel' von Gubenthal re Nachertanie Zveria; P. Struve; Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe; N. CHebyshev; A. Trepov; Order No. 72, August 30, 1914, signed von Rennenkampf, awarding Baron P. Vrangel' St. George's Cross; V. Lekhovich; miscellaneous material re Battle of Kauschen; Lieut.-Gen. A. Kutepov; P. Krasnov; greetings from miscellaneous Russian emigre organizations, includes Soiuz Russkikh Inzhenerov (S. Verhovskoy), Rossiiskoe Obshchestvo Krasnago Kresta and others; publication of Vrangel's memoir: S. Krechetov and "Medny Wssadnik Verlag," The English Review; letters on occasion of illness, ; typescript and handwritten, April 1, 1921-April 20, 1928
Decrees and orders of the Commander-in-Chief of the Russian Army, Baron P. Vrangel', typescript, handwritten and printed,

Correspondence re publication of Beloe Delo, (Letopis' Beloi bor'by); Baron P. Vrangel'; Lieut.-Gen. A. von Lampe; Prince A. Lieven; L. Semenovskii; N. Savich; Prince G. Leikhtenbergskii; S. Paleolog; V. Davats: review of Beloe Delo, clipping; miscellaneous material, financing of publication; typescript, handwritten and printed matter,
Sinking of the yacht "Lucullus," miscellaneous material, includes: report of official French investigation; corresponence re legal proceedings to recover damages; typescript and handwritten.
Finansovyi Sovet, minutes of meetings (zhurnal), No. typescript with holograph signatures, November 10, 1920-March 22, 1921

"Delo o prodazhe prosrochennykh zakladov Petrogradskoi Ssudnoi Kazny," typescript,
"Delo o peredache Petrogradskoi Ssudnoi Kazny v vedenie Ministerstva Finansov Korolevstva S.KH.S.," also includes newspaper clippings re transaction, typescript and printed matter,
Kantseliariia Glavnokomanduiushchago Russkoi Armii, miscellaneous material re transfer of Russian War Bonds to Lieut.-Gen. E. Miller, typescript and handwritten,
List of banners and other regalia placed in keeping of the Russian Church in Belgrade, includes photographs,
"Kratkii ocherk deistvii flota pri evakuatsii Kryma v noiabre 1920 i prebyvanie ego na chuzhbine," includes maps indicating route of evacuation, typescript,

Sanitarnaia CHast' Russkoi Armii, "Otchet o deiatel'nosti Sanitarnoi CHasti Russkoi Armii v Konstantinopole" and "Compte-rendu de la Section de Santé du Service de Santé et de Secours aux Réfugiés Russes". Vserossiiskii Soiuz Gorodov: V.D. Kuzmin-Karavaev, "Vserossiiskii Soiuz Gorodov. Revizionnoe obsledovanie deiatel'nosti v Konstantinopol'skom raione," typescript, Constantinople,

Kuzmin-Karavaev, V.D., "TSentral'nyi Ob"edinenyi Komitet Rossiiskago Obshchestva Krasnago Kresta, Vserossiiskago Zemskago Soiuza i Vserossiiskago Soiuza Gorodov. Revizionnoe obsledovanie del i otchetnosti po denezhnym operatsiiam," typescript, Constantinople,

Clippings, miscellaneous, mostly Russian emigre newspapers, March 19-December 3, 1921. Includes: Golos Rusi, Obshchee Delo, Le Gaulois, Novaia Russkaia ZHizn', Prikarpatskaia Rus', L'Humanité, Rul', La France de l'ouest, Novoe Vremia, Presse du soir, Posledniia Novosti, Volia Rossii

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Material, officially classified as secret and used in Delo, including documents and correspondence related to transfer of power from Lieut.-Gen. A. Denikin to Baron P. Vrangel'. Albums of photographs representing Russian Army abroad and bound volumes of greetings addressed to Baron P. Vrangel' by various emigre groups and organizations. P.W. 1-25.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes Kiev, Rostov, KHar'kov, Taganrog, Ekaterinoslav, Novorossiisk and Kursk Front. Prints depict airplanes, armored trains, tanks and other vehicles; navy vessels, river flotilla; group photographs of White Army in action and on parade; female volunteers; Bolshevik atrocities; Gens. Kornilov, Mai-Maevskii, Shkuro, Popov, Semiletov, Konovodov. Label caption reads: General Baron Vrangel's personal archives. 100 (hundred) photographs of the civil war in South Russia until the Crimean period.
